142 The Central Place Theory is a geographical model that aims to explain size and distribution of urban centers. The validity of this model for the study of ancient sacred landscapes has been recently stressed by Rous in a research on Republican sanctuaries in Latium

Rous embraces an economic approach to explain distribution and function of Latial cult places during the Republican age. The basic principle of this approach consists in an analogy between cult place and market, given the strong link that existed between ancient cult places and economic activities.
